sub_topic: Show that every group of order 96 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C96, the alternating group A4 × C4 × C2, or one of the 196 non-abelian groups of order 96.
message_1: How many non-isomorphic groups of order 96 are there, and what are they?
message_2:
There are 15 non-isomorphic groups of order 96. They are:

1. C96 (Cyclic group of order 96)
2. C48 × C2
3. C32 × C3
4. C24 × C4
5. C16 × C6
6. C8 × C12
7. C4 × C24
8. C2 × C48
9. C2 × (C16 × C3)
10. C2 × (C8 × C4)
11. C2 × (C4 × C6)
12. C2 × (C2 × C24)
13. C2 × (C2 × (C8 × C3))
14. C2 × (C2 × (C4 × C4))
15. C2 × (C2 × (C2 × C12))

These groups are constructed using direct products of cyclic groups of various orders. The numbers in the group names represent the orders of the cyclic groups. For example, C48 × C2 is the direct product of a cyclic group of order 48 and a cyclic group of order 2.
